intro: Ibicella nelsoniana, commonly known as Nelson's ibis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Ibicella nelsoniana is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
